author: cutegeek1337
title: Very nice minifig
review:
This was my first Nexo Knights set or minifig, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  Overall, I think he makes a wonderful addition to my collection.

Box/Instructions

The clamshell box is a nice touch.  The front has a nice image of the guard and it folds out to show a nice little depiction of the Nexo Knight's sci-fi/fantasy countryside.  The blend of the two genres has intrigued me since the first pictures of the first wave came out last year because it reminds me of what I always imagined as a kid playing with my Castle and Space Legos at the same time.

Parts

The only parts are for the minifig

Minifigures

The minifig is very detailed for a generic character.  His legs have intricate armor plates printed on the front.  This printing carries onto the front of the torso.  The back of the torso is also printed with what appear to be overlapping plates to protect the guard's spine.  The chest has the King's crest.  The shoulder plates are nicely detailed and have studs on the back to attach accessories or bricks (not included) and a cutout in the front to allow the crest to show through.  The head is two-sided, with a concerned look on one side and an angry grimace on the other.  While wearing the helmet, only the eyes are visible, but the two expressions do have distinctly different eyes so that works.  The only negative thing I can say is that mine was a little loose in the connection between the legs and the torso; the legs did not lock in as securely as most minifigs.  Since I only have one of these, I don't know if that is common for all of them or if I got one that was a little off.  It is still tight enough that the legs don't just fall off, so I can live with that.

The build

The minifig comes pre-built, so there is no real "build" to this at all.

The completed model

See minifigure section

Overall opinion

As I said in the beginning, I like this minifig and am very happy with my first Nexo Knights addition to my collection.  I certainly wouldn't mind getting my hands on a few more to make a nice little entourage of futuristic guards.
